H3.text: where was st peter killed. Rome

A4.text: According to Christian tradition, Peter was crucified in Rome under Emperor Nero.

A5.text: Unitarian theologian Donald Fay Robinson has suggested that the incident in Acts 12:1â€“17, where Peter is 'released by an angel' and goes to 'another place', really represents an idealised account of his death, which may have occurred in a Jerusalem prison as early as AD 44.

A6.text: Catholic response to Protestant claims that Peter never visited Rome

A7.text: The martyrdom of both the apostles Peter and Paul occurred in Rome.

A8.text: Catholics believe that the Vatican is the last resting place of St. Peter.
